newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks close lower on weak fundamentals.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks close lower on weak fundamentals.

text.p: Seoul stocks closed Saturday's half-day session lower after the early technical rebound was outpaced by selling on weak fundamentals, brokers said.
The composite index closed at 641.83, down 0.25 of a point. It fluctuated from 638.39 to 647.14 during the session.
"Overall mood continued to be bleak as investors saw no change in the fundamentals, such as high interest rates," said Koh Kyung-bae of Hyundai Securities.
Friday's finance ministry announcement that it had scrapped ceilings on foreign borrowings by banks and companies had little impact on trading.
Declining stocks led advancers by 440 to 326.
Midopa Department Store, Dainong and Shindongbang -- which have been at the centre of a hostile takeover talk -- all fell to daily limits as investors saw the talk had died as a market-moving factor.
The Sungwon Group said on Friday it would sell its holding of Midopa shares to Dainong, Midopa's largest shareholder.
Midopa fell by 2,000 won to 23,400, Dainong by 500 won to 5,850 and Shindongbang by 2,500 won to 28,900.
